title: x86 instrinsic _mm_insert_epi8 is not being inlined
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
use std::arch::x86_64::*;

pub fn f(src: *const u8, dst: *mut u8) {
    unsafe {
        let v = _mm_loadu_si128(src as *const _);
        let v = _mm_insert_epi8(v, 0xFF, 0);
        _mm_storeu_si128(dst as *mut _, v);
    }
}
```

[Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=release&edition=2018&gist=d6d35edae2793e9c0e76e6f3d9efd418)

I expected to see this happen:

In release mode, assembly like this:
```asm
playground::f:
	movups	xmm0, xmmword ptr [rdi]
	mov eax, 255
	pinsrb	xmm0, eax, 0
	movups	xmmword ptr [rsi], xmm0
	ret
```

Instead, this happened:

The `_mm_insert_epi8` instrinsic did not get inlined, producing the following assembly:
```asm
core::core_arch::x86::sse41::_mm_insert_epi8:
	movdqa	xmm0, xmmword ptr [rsi]
	mov	eax, 255
	pinsrb	xmm0, eax, 0
	movdqa	xmmword ptr [rdi], xmm0
	ret

playground::f:
	push	rbx
	sub	rsp, 32
	mov	rbx, rsi
	movups	xmm0, xmmword ptr [rdi]
	movaps	xmmword ptr [rsp + 16], xmm0
	mov	rdi, rsp
	lea	rsi, [rsp + 16]
	call	core::core_arch::x86::sse41::_mm_insert_epi8
	movaps	xmm0, xmmword ptr [rsp]
	movups	xmmword ptr [rbx], xmm0
	add	rsp, 32
	pop	rbx
	ret
```

### Meta

I tried stable (1.46.0) and nightly from playground.
